DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program Correlative Study Protocol Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for a correlative study designed to translate basic science findings into clinically useful tools, as assigned by the Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program (CTEP) sponor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program Correlative Study Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for a study designed to translate basic science findings into clinically useful tools, as assigned by the Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program (CTEP) sponor.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program Correlative Study
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program (CTEP) is the program within the Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (DCTD) of the NCI which plans, assesses, and coordinates all aspects of clinical trials including extramural clinical research programs, internal resources, treatment methods and effectiveness, and compilation and exchange of data as it pertains to the development and evaluation of anticancer agents.:Studies designed to translate basic science findings into clinically useful tools.  Includes marker research.

Concepts.definition: The program within the Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (DCTD) of the NCI which plans, assesses, and coordinates all aspects of clinical trials including extramural clinical research programs, internal resources, treatment methods and effectiveness, and compilation and exchange of data as it pertains to the development and evaluation of anticancer agents.
A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.
